name: Java

typing.description: Java uses static typing - all variables must be declared with specific types that cannot change

learning_curve: Moderate - Requires understanding of OOP concepts
description: Java is a class-based, object-oriented programming language designed to be platform-independent through the Java Virtual Machine (JVM). Created by James Gosling at Sun Microsystems in 1995, it follows the principle of 'Write Once, Run Anywhere' and is widely used in enterprise environments.

syntax_style.case_convention: camelCase for variables and methods, PascalCase for classes

compiler_interpreter.type: Compiled to bytecode, then interpreted by JVM
compiler_interpreter.execution: Compile to .class files, run on JVM

language_requirements.file_naming: Filename must match public class name
language_requirements.class_structure: Everything must be inside a class
language_requirements.imports: Must import classes from other packages

challenges: Verbose syntax compared to modern languages
Memory consumption higher than native languages
